intro: Rubus koehleri, commonly known as the Koehler’s blackberry, is a species of bramble native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, typical of the Rubus genus. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are often dark purple or black when ripe. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
